page.title: 07DAMS AND WATER CATCHMENTS.
page.content: All three reservoirs in the Wessenden Valley chain were constructed by using earth dams not concrete ones. This reflects their age, 1839 to 1907. It is also interesting to note that the overflow and overflow portal from Butterley Reservoir are listed buildings. Butterley reservoir also has a pumping station so that water can be sent along a catchment system to Deer Hill Reservoir. There is also another catchment system in this area to send water by gravity from Wessenden Head Reservoir to top up both Deer Hill and Blackmoorfoot Reservoirs. Both these catchments follow the hillside round Binn Moor.
